channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Shopping trolley on pavement., 27th July
item.description:
I reported this to the local Sainsbury's store yesterday (Saturday, 26 July 2025) but the large trolley is still obstructing the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oaklands Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branches in river by first bridge in Brook Park., 27th July
item.description:
Buddlea shrub has been cut down in Brooksway Park by the first bridge but large branches are now in the river which will become blocked if they are left there. Could these be removed please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: An overflowing bin in Burney st at the junction with Crooms Hill and a collapsed public bench, 27th July
item.description:
There is bin on Burney Street by the little public 'green area', on the corner of Crooms Hill, that is overflowing with rubbish. It has been like this for at least 4 weeks. Also the bench in this little green area is completely broken and collapsed and is an eyesore. This has also been like this for weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burney Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Playground broken pavement and litter, 27th July
item.description:
The playground floor is broken and filled with litter. There is often broken glass and takeaway boxes left allover the play area. The current cleaning is insufficient and put children at risk of injury and infections.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clifton Crescent, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised estate agent sign attached to Council-owned street sign, 27th July
item.description:
Previously removed, unauthorised estate agent sign has been re-attached to the Council-owned street sign (as it is not allowed on Woodstock Gardens building property, per lease).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxgrove Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Smashed flagstones on pavement and grass verge, 27th July
item.description:
Smashed flagstones and rubble have been dumped on the pavement and under bushes on the adjacent grass verge close to lampstand number 7 in Lytham Close, next to where a door was dumped a few days ago which is still there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lytham Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commercial waste (chippy) bags ripped open, 27th July
item.description:
...and with fox poo on them. Disgusting. These have been here since yesterday and probably won't be picked up until Monday. The commercial waste collection doesn't work.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
